title: 2 Quick Ways to Remove an iCloud Mail Address From an iPhone

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. This is the grey cog icon. Keep in mind that disabling your iCloud mail account doesn't delete or otherwise affect your mail. You just won't receive any new notifications or mail on your iPhone. To permanently turn off iCloud Mail, you'll need to delete the Apple ID , which is not recommended.

steps.title: Tap your Apple account.
steps.content: Tap your Apple account. This is at the very top of the screen.

steps.title: Tap iCloud.
steps.content: Tap iCloud . You can find this below Subscriptions .

steps.title: Tap iCloud Mail.
steps.content: Tap iCloud Mail . This is below the Apps Using iCloud header.

steps.title: Toggle off "Use on this iPhone".
steps.content: Toggle off "Use on this iPhone". The switch will turn grey. iCloud Mail will now be disabled.

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. This is the grey cog icon.

steps.title: Tap Apps.
steps.content: Tap Apps . You may need to scroll to find this option. If you haven't updated to iOS 18, skip this step.

steps.title: Tap Mail.
steps.content: Tap Mail . This is next to the envelope icon. If you haven't updated to iOS 18, you'll find this under Passwords .

steps.title: Tap Accounts.
steps.content: Tap Accounts . This will be towards the middle of the screen.

steps.title: Tap an account.
steps.content: Tap an account. You'll see a list of all currently added mail accounts. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Delete Account.
steps.content: Tap Delete Account . This is at the bottom.

steps.title: Tap Delete Account again.
steps.content: Tap Delete Account again. The email account will be removed from your iPhone. To delete another email, tap it, and then tap Delete Account twice.
